Fees

To fulfill the expectations and possibilities of the clients the Law Firm offers a choice of systems of reconciliation of payments for legal services:

  • A system of record of working hours
  • A system of lump-sum settlements
  • A system of lump-sum settlement with a limit of hours
  • A system of settlement of the bonus for the success (success fee)
  • Fees for the conduct of court proceedings

A system of record of working hours

The legal counsel suggests his hourly rate of remuneration which is dependent on the difficulty of the case. The client pays only for time that was dedicated to resolve his legal problems. If an agreement is not signed with the firm, the client, of course, does not pay. The exact payroll processing is presented to the client together with an invoice for legal services.

A system of lump-sum settlements

If the client wishes, the firm may propose a lump sum settlement system for the matter concerned. This system is very useful for clients who want to know immediately the total cost of legal service. It should be noted, however, that the lump-sum remuneration may be in some cases higher than the record of working hours.

A system of lump-sum settlement with a limit of hours

For our regular clients the firm offers the so-called system of lump-sum settlement with a limit of hours. This system is very beneficial because it allows the clients to plan their expenses and saves maximum of time and costs incurred.

A system of settlement of the bonus for the success (success fee)

In some cases, mostly in court legal proceedings, the firm may agree with his client on an additional fee. The most important element of such remuneration is in this case the so-called bonus for success or for winning the case (so-called success fee). The bonus is often negotiated as a percentage of the claim.

Fees for the conduct of court proceedings

Remuneration for representation in courts is determined depending on the type of case, and the value of the subject of the dispute, not lower than the minimum rates specified in the resolution of the Minister of Justice of October 22, 2015. about fees for the actions of lawyers (official Gazette, 2015. position 1804). For the satisfactory performance constituting an analysis of the factual and legal circumstances before making by the client a final order on conducting the case, the system of record of working hours shall be applied for every commenced hour analysis of the case (except for cases conducted within the agreed lump sum).
